Welcome to my portfolio! I am a candidate for an M.S. in Computer Science at UMass Amherst, concentrating in Data Science. Throughout my undergraduate studies in Industrial Engineering, I was introduced to the intersections between computer programming and statistics, which led me to realize that data science was a perfect amalgamation my interests. Other than working and studying, I spend my time baking, pouring latte art, traveling, and playing the piano. I am also the planning team director for a new hackathon being hosted at UMass! In my career, I hope to use statistics, computer science, and optimization to make a more efficient world.

Projects

Audie

SheHacks Boston Hackathon Winner

January 2018

Audie the Bear

I participated in SheHacks, the worldâ€™s largest all-female and non-binary hackathon in January 2018. In 36 hours, a team of three hackers and I created Audie. Audie won the following awards, Competing with over 150 teams of hackers:

  1. She </SMILES>
  2. Best Hack that Makes the Process of a Hospital Visit Better

Purpose

Audie is a bear made to make improve hospital experiences for children. Audie's purpose is to facillitate discussions with children about feelings, especially for children who may experience difficulty expressing their feelings directly to adults.

How Audie Works

Audie's goal is for patients to feel heard, but not intimidated by their patient experience. Audie is a bear that is activated by sound and records speech. Patients will talk about how their feelings and Audie will encode their words into a sentiment value once a recording has been made. This value reflects how positive or negative what the patient says is. From here, a doctor can access the sentiment data of the patient and make an assessment on the patient's progress. To do this, we leveraged Google Cloud's NLP and Speech APIs, MATLAB, and an Arduino circuit.

Learn more about Audie at:

  • Audie's Github
  • Audie's Devpost

    Consulting Website

    Purpose

    Movie Big Data

    Visualizing Movies with Apache Zeppelin

    December 2017

    Visualizing Movie Data

    Big Data Analytics Final Project

    In this final project, I analyzed movie data with Apache Spark data frames and created interactive visualizations with Apache Zeppelin. The dataset used was provided by MovieLens and contains over 45,000 movies. Data were stored in the ml-latest.zip file which contains 224 MB of data.

    Purpose

    Utilize Zeppelin and Spark Technologies, as well as SQL queries to create interactive and dynamic visualizations of the MovieLens dataset and discover how the movie landscape has changed over time.

    Notebook

    The Zeppelin Notebook is stored in two links:
    • Notebook
    • Source Code

    Senior Capstone Project

    Multimodal Trip Planning Tool

    September 2016 - May 2017

    Personalized Multimodal Urban Travel Planning

    Senior Capstone Project

    For my senior capstone project, I worked in a team of students, an academic advisor, and a Ford data scientist sponsor, to create a multi-modal trip planning tool for the Boston metropolitan area that recommends personalized travel. This project won the "Biggest Impact" Capstone Award, competing against over 20 capstone teams.

    Problem Statement

    Transportation is constantly growing and evolving to meet the demands of people. Modern travelers, especially in urban settings, have a wide variety of transportation options. Therefore, this project is focused on building a multi-modal trip planning tool for the Boston metropolitan area as a case study. The tool will recommend personalized travel, based on a userâ€™s preferences surrounding travel time, delays, costs, number of transfers, and comfort.

    Deliverables

    • Exectutive Summary
    • Final Presentation
    • Final Report
    • Trip Planning Tool
    • Poster

    Individual Contributions

    • Organized the case study data analysis and designed the case study diagrams
    • Created data visualizations for the data gathered from MBTA and Hubway with Tableau
    • Collaborated in mathematical model selection and formulation
    • Completed "Data Collection and Analysis" section of the Report and Poster
    • Built the algorithm and user interface in Excel

    Capital Allocation Paper

    Credit Suisse Corporate Insights

    May - June 2015

    Credit Suisse Capital Allocation Paper

    During my co-op at Credit Suisse HOLT, I had the privilege of working with the Corporate Insights Team to prepare data for the Capital Allocation Paper. Collaborating with the Corporate Advisory team, I leveraged HOLT's Oracle database of over 20,000 companiesâ€™ financial information to visualize data for a capital allocation publication that was shared with CEOs of major corporations.

    Publication

    The paper was published and distributed by Credit Suisse. The online publication can be found here.

    Individual Contributions

    • Collaborated with the Corporate Insights Team on data exploration
    • Queried data in SQL to classify companies as "Returners" or "Reinvestors" (See Fig. 2)
    • Visualized the data with dynamic spreadsheets to aid research
    • Recognized for data analysis (See Page 15)
